awards:
第26届釜山国际电影节(2021)
　　新浪潮奖 最佳影片(提名) 莎瑞帕·乌扎兹巴耶娃

writer.name: 莎瑞帕·乌扎兹巴耶娃 Sharipa Urazbayeva

director.name: 莎瑞帕·乌扎兹巴耶娃 Sharipa Urazbayeva

introduction: Recently-married Anar (Ainur BERMUKHAMBETOVA) has relocated to a remote rural village in Kazakhstan with her unreliable husband and her rebellious stepson, Adil. Separated from her parents, made unemployed, and soon to be abandoned by her man, she also has to deal with pregnancy while being anaemic. When her husband’s creditors arrive and she learns that Adil was raped, she has to somehow find a way to fight back against sorrow and misfortune...Writer/director Sharipa URAZBAYEVA’s sophomore feature Red Pomegranate is a return to her woman-against-a-conservative-world storytelling, as seen with her first film Mariam, only here the litany of issues is ripe for melodrama. Running counter to expectations is the presentation, which is an austere drama driven by Ainur BERMUKHAMBETOVA’s powerful performance - those expressive eyes! - silences and a sense of isolation, and poetic imagery drawing upon pomegranates, a symbol of rebirth and moral purification.
